name: dissoluteness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a way of living that people strongly disapprove of because it is morally bad: She thanked him lovingly for having put a stop to the dissoluteness of her life. Great dissoluteness prevailed in the king's court. See
dissoluteSynonyms
debauchery
dissipation (BAD BEHAVIOUR)
immorality
More examplesFewer examplesEnough dissoluteness! Where are decency and purity?There is an air of dissoluteness about every place we visited in this locality.He prayed that she might fall into a grievous illness, which might arrest the course of her dissoluteness and make her return to her former self.
